title: Minor Scale Formula
description: Learn the W-H-W-W-H-W-W pattern that builds every natural minor scale.

steps.title: The Minor Scale Pattern
steps.description:
The natural minor scale has its own formula:

W - H - W - W - H - W - W

Compared to the major scale (W-W-H-W-W-W-H), the 3rd, 6th, and 7th notes are lowered by a half step. This gives the minor scale its characteristic dark, sad, or moody sound.

steps.title: A Natural Minor
steps.description: Play A natural minor: A-B-C-D-E-F-G. Like C major, it uses only white keys — but starting on A gives it a minor feel.
steps.hint: All white keys from A to G.

steps.title: Tracing the Formula
steps.description:
Let's trace W-H-W-W-H-W-W on A:

• A + W = B
• B + H = C (natural half step)
• C + W = D
• D + W = E
• E + H = F (natural half step)
• F + W = G
• G + W = A

The formula aligns with the white keys when starting on A.

steps.title: D Natural Minor
steps.description: Apply the formula on D: D-E-F-G-A-Bb-C. One flat: Bb.

steps.title: E Natural Minor
steps.description: Play E natural minor: E-F#-G-A-B-C-D. One sharp: F#.
